Message.Title: Here is proof that analysis are clueless
Message.Msg: Look at eps trend over period of time. Just keep lowering it without lowering the price target. http://finance.yahoo.com/q/ae?s=AMZN+Analyst+Estimates

Message.Title: Not Clueless...."Crooked"
Message.Msg: Not one of them will come out and say "sell" this overvalued / over inflated" internet retailer even though mathmatically AMZN could never sell enough products to even remotely grow into the current valuation. iPad mini, Nexus, Surface competition will definitely reduce Kindle sales, but the stock doesn't flinch. Furthermore, how and why are the analyst letting AMZN get away with not mentioning exact number of sales of their Kindle product and subsequent digital sales per product?? All you need to do is look at AMZN vs AAPL treatment on wall street and you will see why most of main street thinks the market is "RIGGED".

Topic.Title: Here is proof that analysis are clueless

Message.Msg: now the spin is that it's all because they are "investing" the money into their business as the excuse of lowered earnings. The issue there is that when INTC or any company does that, they still have a profit model to make money while doing it. AMZN isn't. So while the anlayst think they are bleeding the competition, they are , in fact, bleeding themselves. as shown by the higher liability ratios building up versus their cash: they haven't been making money the last few qtrs while their competiton has a boatload from making money through the whole cycle since 2008. You can't introduce everything and constantly be hailed a "loss leader" perpetually. You have to make money. And now it's not just about making money with the stock valued historically as levels where companies make double digit earnings /per share in a year based on their share price. AMZN isn't making even making pennies. I can't believe there's not one anlayst out there taking them to task on this while AAPL gets hit on them slowing down. That makes little sense but then again, it makes little sense to park you hard earned money in stocks with high double, then triple, and now quadruple earnings mutliples. There's been many hindsight examples of that being completely stupid. Have to see if history ryhmes ahead.

Topic.Title: Not Clueless...."Crooked"

Message.Msg: Well said. Didn't the SEC recently get after Mahaney? Based upon the intellectually dishonest analysis by the analysts, it does lead one to wonder if many of them have other "incentives" that are guiding their price targets... Doesn't matter shorts. Be conservative. Reserve cash for squeezes. The cash flow yield here is abysmal and getting worse. It levered up and increased fixed cost structure at exactly the wrong time. The entire hardware business model was flawed. Cash and cash flow are king. Amazon's has been degrading rapidly... It is now a real option that has a time to expiration that is quickly shrinking due to malinvestment and the value of the stock will collapse rapidly as that cash flow reality become clear to large holders...

Topic.Title: Its official.... Coinmaker jerks off more than geegee and nasdaq6000

Message.Msg: This stock is dead, regardless of CM. I've learned after years of beating MOMO #$%$ (NFLX, GMCR, CMG) that when message boards get down to the paid pumpers (GG, NASD, NEM, BH) and reasoned bears, it is a matter of time. The wounded stock usually strike back hard with long only funds selling calls like mad and fast money boys taking it up and down, trying hard to squeeze weak shorts and longs on each side. In the process, more people become disaffected with the capital markets daily. I really do have a feeling that the institutional longs are doing the right thing (and sparing themselves lawsuits) by selling right through the squeeze attempts and letting the air out gradually (and knocking out the predatory traders who have driven so many retail investors out of the market). When these scams end, retail comes back, but not before then....
